hedline.hl1: Coca-Cola Signs Deal On Programming TV's

abstract.p: Coca-Cola Co signs two-year strategic partnership agreement with Replay TV, which sells a service and digital video recorder that allows consumers to pause, replay, rewind and fast-forward through live television programming; Coca-Cola is second marketer, after Universal Pictures, to work with Replay TV, which is stirring concerns among advertisers because their services enable viewers to more easily skip commercials (S)

block.p: Coca-Cola, the world's largest soft-drink company, has signed a two-year strategic partnership agreement with Replay TV in Mountain View, Calif., which sells a service and digital video recorder that allows consumers to pause, replay, rewind and fast-forward through live television programming. Terms were not disclosed.

''We think this technology will become a part of consumers' lives,'' said Chuck Fruit, vice president and director for media and marketing assets at Coca-Cola in Atlanta, ''so we've got some experimentation and learning to do.''

Coca-Cola, the world's largest soft-drink company, has signed a two-year strategic partnership agreement with Replay TV in Mountain View, Calif., which sells a service and digital video recorder that allows consumers to pause, replay, rewind and fast-forward through live television programming. Terms were not disclosed.

''We think this technology will become a part of consumers' lives,'' said Chuck Fruit, vice president and director for media and marketing assets at Coca-Cola in Atlanta, ''so we've got some experimentation and learning to do.''

With the agreement, to be announced today, Coca-Cola becomes the second marketer after the Universal Pictures unit of Seagram to work with Replay TV, which along with a competitor, TiVo, is stirring concerns among advertisers because their services enable viewers to more easily skip commercials.

''We want to learn what kind of brand messages or involvement makes sense in this environment,'' Mr. Fruit said, adding that Coca-Cola would start with sponsorships and banner ads on Replay TV as well as developing cross-promotions.
